DOC.detailed_description: High-flow nasal cannula oxygen ( HFNC ) treatment show several clinical advantage compare conventional oxygen therapy . Currently , report described effect HFNC postoperative patient thoracic surgery . In postoperative period extubation , patient randomly assign either : 1. standard oxygen therapy group ( control group ) 2 . HFNC group ( study group ) . In control group , patient receive oxygen treatment mean conventional face mask , level fraction inspire oxygen ( FiO2 ) set maintain peripheral oxygen saturation ( SpO2 ) = 92 % - 98 % . Patients study group give HFNC treatment gas flow level = 50 L/min FiO2 set maintain peripheral oxygen saturation ( SpO2 ) = 92 % - 98 % . After 48 hour study entry , patient evaluate possible interruption oxygen treatment basis clinical condition .
